Review Text: Damn!  That's all I was able to say just right now as I finished watching.  Great take in cause/effect, choices, and indeed the question if we are pre-destined to a fate. I have to say, soon after the film starts there's like 45minutes or so that can feel like an eternity as it's very slow while a very long conversation b/w the characters takes place, but it sets up the rest beautifully.  Totally worth it.  Ethan Hawke gave a great performance.  Hats off to him.
Review Title: Hats off to Ethan Hawke
Rating: 4.0
--------------------------------------------------

Review Text: 1 1/2 stars at best.  It showed a lot of promise within the first few minutes but once it gets into the story line, it absolutely tanks.  Gotta wonder about who wrote those 5 stars reviews, that coincidentally were all written within a day or two of each other.

Average Rating: 4.6
Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Andy Tennant'], 'Producers': ['Neal Moritz'], 'Starring': ['Jennifer Aniston', 'Gerard Butler', 'Christine Baranski']}
Review Text: Movie started good, got stuck on neutral in the middle, and painfully flopped to the end.  I really enjoy Aniston's character's - maybe it's just her I really like, but that's not here not there - Movie could've used better writing.  Acting was overall okay.  They were just strapped to a poor script.  Though, comedy is not Butler's forte.  Editing was also very suspect.  This is one of those movies where less would've been more -way more.  I barely made it to the end.  Three stars is really generous.  Trailer had movie expectations way higher.  Too bad.
Review Title: Disappointing
Rating: 3.0
--------------------------------------------------

Product Title: French Kiss

Store: Meg Ryan  (Actor),     Kevin Kline  (Actor),     Lawrence Kasidan  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG-13    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment, All Fox Titles
Product Description: ['Meg Ryan ("Sleepless in Seattle") and Kevin Kline ("Dave") star in this bouncy romantic comedy about life, love and larceny. When her Fiancé is smitten by a beautiful Frenchwoman, Kate (Ryan) flies to Paris determined to win him back. However, nothing prepares her for Luc (Kline), a cunning sexy Frenchman with a gift for gab and a fondness for thievery. A self-proclaimed expert on affairs of the heart, Luc promises to help Kate win back her man. But one star-crossed misadventure after another sweeps them across France, ultimately changing them in ways they never dreamed possible.']
Average Rating: 4.7

Really disappointed.

Review Text: I did not read nor I was aware of the book the movie is based on.  However, this movie works great taking you with its charm and quirkiness, wondering how it will develop. As soon as you feel invested in the story and its characters, it becomes a real downer of a movie.
Review Title: Not what it seems...
Rating: 2.0

=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2017/03/01
Average Rating: 4.5
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['Davvisámegiella'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Hannes Holm'], 'Producers': ['Annica Bellander', 'Nicklas Wikström Nicastro'], 'Starring': ['Rolf Lassgård', 'Bahar Pars', 'Zozan Akgün'], 'Studio': ['Music Box Films']}
Review Text: Great story.  What an awesome treat.  You'll ponder, laugh, cry, and smile.  As far as subtitles, Ove would've been very disappointed people cannot figure out to just turn their subtitles on, on the settings!  C'mon people!  It's 2017!  I suppose some just expect for them to automatically be on, but it is a preference, specially with some films having more than one language to choose from for subtitles.  Anyway, very unfair to rate the movie with 1 star just because they couldn't figure it out.  It was nominated for an Oscar for a reason.  It is also the highest-grossing foreign-language film of 2016.  You won't be disappointed!
Review Title: Bra!  (Great in Swedish) ;)
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------

Review Text: I did not read nor I was aware of the book the movie is based on.  However, this movie works great taking you with its charm and quirkiness, wondering how it will develop. As soon as you feel invested in the story and its characters, it becomes a real downer of a movie.
Review Title: Not what it seems...
Rating: 2.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2017/03/01
Average Rating: 4.5
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['Davvisámegiella'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Hannes Holm'], 'Producers': ['Annica Bellander', 'Nicklas Wikström Nicastro'], 'Starring': ['Rolf Lassgård', 'Bahar Pars', 'Zozan Akgün'], 'Studio': ['Music Box Films']}
Review Text: Great story.  What an awesome treat.  You'll ponder, laugh, cry, and smile.  As far as subtitles, Ove would've been very disappointed people cannot figure out to just turn their subtitles on, on the settings!  C'mon people!  It's 2017!  I suppose some just expect for them to automatically be on, but it is a preference, specially with some films having more than one language to choose from for subtitles.  Anyway, very unfair to rate the movie with 1 star just because they couldn't figure it out.  It was nominated for an Oscar for a reason.  It is also the highest-grossing foreign-language film of 2016.  You won't be disappointed!

POSITIVE SUMMARY:
The user has had numerous positive experiences, frequently expressing enthusiasm for films that showcase strong performances, compelling narratives, and engaging cinematography. Many reviews indicate enjoyment of the character development and storytelling, particularly in movies that evoke emotional reactions, be it laughter or introspection. A few standout performances, especially noted in reviews, have left a lasting impression, contributing to the overall satisfaction with the viewing experience. High ratings consistently highlight the user's appreciation for cinematic quality and the emotional resonance of films.

NEGATIVE SUMMARY:

Critical reviews emphasize frustration with slow pacing, uninspired scripts, and anticlimactic endings that detract from initial promise. The user expressed skepticism about overly positive reviews, questioning their authenticity, particularly when juxtaposed with their negative experiences. Some emotional letdowns were also noted, where the user felt misled by movie trailers or initial impressions.

OVERALL SUMMARY:
The user's purchase history reveals a strong appreciation for quality cinema, with multiple positive reactions highlighting powerful performances and evocative storytelling. However, criticism arises regarding inconsistent film quality, including disappointing writing and character arcs, technical issues, and deceptive marketing. Overall, the user balances moments of elation from good films with frustration stemming from subpar experiences, showcasing a complex relationship with their selections where emotional highs and lows coexist.

target_interaction.title: Masterpiece
target_interaction.text: It might be an acquired taste and definitely not a Hollywood blockbuster.  But certainly a real gem from Inarritu.  Magnificent at so many levels.  I do wonder if Galifianakis was miscast for his role, but that's just nitpicking on my part.  Watched more than twice to catch all the brilliant nuances.  The score really should've been considered for the Oscar!
